CatDescriptText: Mr. Neville Stein, hospital worker, 117 Anderson Street., was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 19, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that cab drivers in general take advantage of other motorists and pedestrians in traffic? As a group, would you call them courteous or discourteous?" answer reads: "Ninety per cent of the cab drivers are courteous.  I've seen them give pedestrians plenty of consideration."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Neville Stein wearing light colored button down collared shirt with breast pocket, hands on hips, standing in front of brick building with garage door and no parking sign
